docs.title: Task Manager API
docs.text:
This documentation describes the backend of the Task Manager project, built with FastAPI, JS, and SQLite.

The API exposes CRUD operations for tasks, YAML import, admin endpoints, and health/debug utilities.

Version: 1.0.1

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
The backend follows a clean, modular FastAPI structure:

app/
├── main.py           # FastAPI application and routes
├── db.py             # Database
├── models.py         # ORM models
├── schemas.py        # Pydantic schemas
└── ...

docs.title: Task Model (SQLAlchemy)
docs.text: Fields: - id: integer, primary key - title: string - description: string - status: string (TODO, IN_PROGRESS, DONE) - created_at: datetime - updated_at: datetime

docs.title: TaskUpdate
docs.text:
• title: str | None
  • description: str | None
  • status: str | None

docs.title: TaskOut
docs.text:
• id: integer, primary key
  • title: string
  • description: string
  • status: string (TODO, IN_PROGRESS, DONE)
  • created_at: datetime
  • updated_at: datetime

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Retrieves the full list of tasks stored in the database. Tasks are returned in descending order of ID, meaning the most recently created tasks appear first.

This endpoint does not require authentication.

docs.title: Status codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 200 Successful retrieval of tasks

docs.title: Response body
docs.text:
A JSON array of TaskOut objects:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "Buy groceries",
    "description": "Milk, eggs, bread",
    "status": "TODO",
    "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:22:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2025-01-10T14:22:00Z"
  }
]
